Text: Stopped by Columbia Falls City Hall to discuss key infrastructure projects, supporting our first responders, and ensuring the CFAC Plant gets a proper cleanup. https://t.co/jnAi2utDP6

KALISPELL: $14.5 million is coming to Glacier Park International Airport from my bipartisan infrastructure law.

We’re going to grow our economy and create jobs by making critical transportation upgrades, which will drive down prices and keep Montanans connected. https://t.co/vW7XQSRyNV

Talked housing, workforce, high-speed internet, and more with the Flathead Area Young Professionals. These young leaders are putting the work in to improve their communities, and their input is crucial as we fight to address the needs of Montana families. https://t.co/rtmzLmIYKd

Spent some time this morning touring the Kalispell Veterans Center and hearing about the local needs of our vets. Grateful for the folks working hard to get our fighting men and women good care, and I’ll keep working in Washington to get them the resources they need. https://t.co/aKyNgde27i
No better way to start a day in Kalispell than talking with John and Robin at @KGEZ1! https://t.co/rt91x17t2z

.@Montana_FFA not only keeps one of our proudest traditions strong, but also helps young Montanans develop into our state's next generation of ag leaders. Such an honor to visit with these Missoula kids and hear all about the work they're doing with the meat processing program. https://t.co/iMZrMwEgJB

Putin’s reckless actions are unnecessarily threatening millions of people and making the world less safe. I stand with our allies and the free people of Ukraine against Russia’s military aggression and illegal provocations.

Sub-zero temps couldn’t keep me from celebrating the dedication of MSO’s new terminal.

This expansion will create good-paying jobs, help Montana families stay connected, and boost our outdoor economy. I’m proud to have helped secure the resources to move this project forward. https://t.co/hy4tNbO327
Kicked off a brisk day in Missoula with NBC Montana's @HeidiNBCMT and Mike Powers of @kpaxnews. https://t.co/QGXSNsStHa

It's #PublicSchoolsWeek! As a former public school teacher, I'm proud to have led my colleagues in celebrating our teachers, admins, parents, and students with this designation.

I'll keep fighting to strengthen our public education system to ensure every student can succeed. https://t.co/FQxzMDiJYA

Talked right to repair, cattle price transparency, and investing in rural infrastructure on the latest Open Mic podcast from @agripulse.

Check it out ▶ https://t.co/afyIrltNwZ

We have got to get our China competition bill signed into law ASAP. The bottom line is that our national security depends on ensuring America remains the world leader in scientific and technological innovation to counter growing threats from our adversaries.

It just doesn't add up. Families are paying record prices for beef, yet our ranchers can barely make ends meet.

So where's all that money going? To just four big packers who've consolidated the industry and driven out competition. We've got to stop this.
https://t.co/IKkMTJ5xDX

We're getting infrastructure investments out the door as efficiently and effectively as possible. Here's a rundown on the latest:

—$225 million for MT bridges
—1st $11.5 million for MT public transit
—1st $28.5 million for MT airports
—1st $2.5 million for the Milk River Project
The Violence Against Women Act expired in 2019. It's long overdue that we get its lifesaving programs back up and running.

We can't let four major corporations jack up the price of beef to force family ranchers like the Charters out of business. Let's pass my bill to put some teeth into the Packers and Stockyard Act and crack down on their anti-competitive practices once and for all. https://t.co/gXShDuiJ1f

A victory for Montana, for our outdoor economy and heritage, and for every American that cares about what happens to our nation's greatest treasures: our public lands and wildlife.

Congratulations @USFWS Director Martha Williams! https://t.co/JmBXjzOtAS

Grateful to Dylan, Kasha, and Lucy for stepping up to serve their fellow Montanans as interns in my DC office this spring. If Congress worked half as hard as these three, we'd all be better for it! https://t.co/CSZ8sTLalg

Enjoyed meeting with Montana's Primary Care Association and hearing from those running community health centers all across the state. These folks are truly doing the Lord's work in keeping Montanans healthy. https://t.co/dlFLp6QtiZ
So good to see you back in the saddle, @SenatorLujan. Wishing you strength and good health through the rest of your recovery, my friend. https://t.co/qGcaBO3dJQ

It's always a good day when the @MTFarmBureau is in town! Discussed important ag issues facing Big Sky Country with Nicole from Miles City and Wes from Circle.

Montana farmers and ranchers work hard to produce the food that feeds this nation, and I'll always have their backs. https://t.co/CdEAUyOwqI

Today, @JerryMoran and I met with the DOD IG’s team to discuss the importance of supporting our servicemembers as they make the transition from military to civilian life, by providing them the mental health care and screenings they need and earned. https://t.co/5jEyOXUSdE

The VA Office of Inspector General plays an absolute critical role in making sure the Department best serves our veterans and taxpayers. Today, I met with VA Inspector General Mike Missal to make sure VA OIG has the tools it needs to keep doing just that. https://t.co/UdTjGUm9CA

Great to see Joe Briggs, Chairman of the Cascade County Commission in Washington today! As we discussed, it's critical we get our defense funding bill across the finish line so our servicemembers at Malmstrom Air Force Base and throughout Great Falls have the resources they need. https://t.co/KM8yAogp1P

BREAKING: My Health Care for Burn Pit Veterans Act just unanimously passed the Senate.

We're one big step closer to connecting an entire generation of toxic-exposed veterans with the VA care they need and cannot wait for any longer.

Had a productive lunch with @MitchLandrieu46 and the bipartisan group I worked with to write the infrastructure package. As we continue to implement this law, we're going to create a ton more jobs and drastically improve our nation's economic standing in the world.

Taking care of our toxic-exposed vets is the continuing cost of war, plain and simple. Had a good meeting today with @WWP CEO Mike Linnington where we discussed the path forward on addressing toxic exposure in a comprehensive way veterans deserve. https://t.co/yAoBNW5V4H

Every farmer knows that equipment doesn't always cooperate—and often craps out before you get the job done.

But time is money on the farm, so it's got to be fixed quick. My bill requires manufacturers to make it easier for farmers to do their own repairs.
https://t.co/mYicJFeV7c

At a pivotal moment for our economic recovery, Mitch McConnell and his followers are blocking Powell’s confirmation and kneecapping the Fed’s ability to combat inflation and lower costs.

Make no mistake: hardworking American families will pay the price for these political games. https://t.co/poREXivvKy

This is unacceptable. It's also a result of Louis DeJoy's effort to run the Postal Service into the ground.

My Postal Reform Act will ensure reliable mail service by putting the @USPS on firm financial ground, guaranteeing delivery 6-days a week, and requiring more transparency. https://t.co/d8F3KL5usu

Dwayne and Rick are Postmasters from my hometown of Big Sandy. They work hard to provide the essential mail services that our rural communities depend on.

The @USPS is critical to Montana's economy and our rural way of life, which is why we need to pass the Postal Reform Act. https://t.co/vNAKJyTDUA

As a former public school teacher and school board member, I know how critical a high-quality public education is to creating a brighter future for our kids.

Every child deserves a high-quality education—no matter who they are or where they live.

Public school teachers and administrators play a central role in shaping the leaders of tomorrow. Their service to our students and communities cannot be overstated.

Today, @SenatorCollins and I introduced a bipartisan resolution to designate next week as Public Schools Week.
Montana is rooting for you, @maggie_voisin! Good luck in the finals—show 'em how we do things in Big Sky Country! #MontanaProud https://t.co/ottfl5Nhvf

Ensuring VA has a top-notch workforce is critically important. As @SVACDems Chairman, it was great to meet with AFGE Montana today and discuss the importance of strengthening Montana VA's workforce to make sure it has the staff in place to best serve Montana veterans. https://t.co/2ngMta5F45

Sat down with Missoula's County Commissioners this morning to talk about the many infrastructure investments heading their way—including a much-needed expansion of public transit. https://t.co/vahspxOpTf
Happy Valentine’s Day to Sharla. Sparks always fly when I’m with you. https://t.co/5th6vYyjKf

The Super Bowl's got nothing on the Brawl of the Wild, but I'm wishing luck to @MontanaGrizFB alum Colt Anderson in tonight's big game. Give 'em hell, coach!
https://t.co/EFcb90I4sw

The current cost of food is just not sustainable—but we can bring these costs down by tackling ag consolidation.

Instead of pointing fingers and playing games, Congress needs to bring my bipartisan bills to a vote and get the American people some relief.

Montana has a rich history of hardrock mining, but too often irresponsible mining companies leave harmful metals and chemicals behind that hurt our environment.

Our infrastructure law addresses this—creating jobs and keeping our outdoor economy strong.
https://t.co/RaDSdAjFoD

The right to repair issue is a consolidation issue. When we allow big equipment manufacturers to monopolize the repair industry, it hurts the farmers in need of timely repairs, the independent mechanics in need of work, and the American people in need of a dependable food supply. https://t.co/XDsnyrufV2

The Land and Water Conservation Fund is the single best conservation tool we have, and we've got a lot of work to do to avoid losing sensitive lands and waters.

That's why I'm leading a bipartisan, bicameral group of lawmakers in pushing for more critical funding for the LWCF. https://t.co/Sac03NlPMh

Members of Congress who put their own interests before the public trust must be held accountable.

It's time to ban stock trading in Congress.

The Violence Against Women Act saves lives, plain and simple. It has crucial resources to support survivors of domestic violence and vital tools to address the Missing and Murdered Indigenous Peoples crisis. It's long past time to renew #VAWA—so let's get it done.

A powerful addition to the largest and most capable Navy in the world. The USS Montana is a force to be reckoned with. #MontanaProud
https://t.co/ZF4w6nkYpn

A producer's bottom line is narrow to begin with, and small repairs shouldn't break the bank. We need the right to repair our own equipment—and I've got a bill that'll secure this right. https://t.co/JBB1NXvpXX

The folks at @Habitat_org do life-changing work, and increasing our affordable housing supply couldn't be more important. When it comes to lowering costs for families and building stronger communities, more affordable housing is the answer. https://t.co/l359NZ7bFs

Great meeting today with Dennis Stoner, President of the Enlisted Association of the National Guard of Montana. We've got to live up to the promises made to our men and women in uniform, which is why I'm laser-focused on getting them the care and benefits they've earned. https://t.co/W2wcohYUcX

Had a good conversation with @davidaxelrod about where our country is today and what we need to do to move forward. (Hint: we can't leave rural America behind)

Give it a listen 🔊
https://t.co/bN30UNhMfL

Thanks to @ruralhealth for inviting me to speak this morning. Whether you live in Manhattan, NY or Manhattan, MT, access to high-quality health care is critical. That's why I'll keep fighting to get our rural health providers the resources and policies they need to do their jobs. https://t.co/E33dCT1fcT

So impressed by the hard work and resiliency of Montana's @SpecialOlympics athletes and advocates. These programs are incredibly valuable to our communities, and I'll always fight to make sure they have the resources they need to succeed. https://t.co/eY1ncYsL36

Had a great meeting today with @IAVA, where we discussed the importance of paying the cost of war and delivering for our toxic-exposed veterans. We started this fight this Congress, and together, we’re going to finish it. https://t.co/I72xzJYIm6

Glad to meet with folks from the Montana Small Business Development Center today. This pandemic put Main Street Montana through the wringer, but we're helping small businesses stay afloat with the American Rescue Plan. https://t.co/E8DZQdLwRw

Grateful for the important work of Montana's rural health advocates. During and beyond this pandemic, we can't leave rural America behind when it comes to providing high-quality health care that everyone can afford. https://t.co/57UlKzuD1X

I don’t know what ‘wordle’ is, but my staff told me we should post this:

“Not wordle, just big packers’ profits during the pandemic.”

We can lower costs for consumers AND get farmers and ranchers a fair shake at the farm gate. It’s a win for everybody—except the big packers.

Congress needs to pick up the pace in addressing consolidation in the ag industry.

High costs at the supermarket are top of mind for many Americans, and I’ve got 4 *bipartisan* bills to help address it ready to go right now.

Let’s get it done.

The @USPS is vital to our communities, especially in rural America. This essential service has long needed reform—and never has that been clearer than under Louis DeJoy's control.

Last night, the House passed crucial Postal Service reforms. Now, the Senate needs to take action.

Want to wish a huge congratulations to Ms. Schmidt out of Whitefish and Ms. Pavlovich out of Livingston for earning this high praise.

These two top-notch teachers show just how big a part Montana educators play in shaping the next generation.
https://t.co/vXz0nqNU86

Make no mistake about it—we'll miss Martha Williams's leadership in Montana, but I'm looking forward to seeing her effective management skills as Director of the @USFWS.

Montana's colleges are pioneers of education and innovation in the Last Best Place. Today, I met with @CarrollCollege President John Cech, @fvccmt President Jane Karas, and FVCC Board Chair Pete Akey to discuss how we can further support our higher ed institutions and students. https://t.co/jGZJ138BKt

🚨 New infrastructure investment announced for Montana: $11.5 million for public transit!

As the Treasure State continues to grow, it's critical that we have safe, affordable public transportation options in every corner of the state. It'll create jobs and keep folks connected.

High-speed internet is coming to an underserved area near you! Using American Rescue Plan funds, Montana is expanding broadband throughout the state.

Whether it's remote work, telehealth, or distance learning, access to high-speed internet is essential.
https://t.co/I04KgGLMHx

This is ridiculous. Corporations are using the pandemic as an excuse to jack up costs on American consumers when they can least afford it.

I won’t stop fighting to hold them accountable and make sure they are treating ranchers and consumers fairly.
https://t.co/gckhmEZr0S

Great to see Montana's own Buzz Mattelin representing the National Barley Growers Association in Washington today. Production ag is the backbone of Montana's economy, and I'll never stop fighting for our farmers and ranchers. https://t.co/dgUlH4IkD7

It’s an honor to receive @FRAHQ’s Pinnacle Award, and to fight alongside them on behalf of all our men and women who protect our country at sea.

We’ll keep working together to deliver for our veterans and servicemembers—including those exposed to toxic substances. https://t.co/7xkNqahCPW

Members of Congress shouldn't be actively buying or selling individual stocks, period. We're elected to serve the American people—not to use our position to line our own pockets.

The Ban Conflicted Trading Act will help keep Congress accountable, and I'm proud to support it.

Good. This is the kind of garbage that drives me crazy. The IRS has absolutely no business requiring facial recognition software on anything—but especially not when it comes to allowing Montana taxpayers to access services.
https://t.co/BUndjgTEaz

These two Montanans out of Gallatin High have some bright futures ahead of them. Congrats again to Chase and Melaina for being chosen to participate in the Senate Youth Program! https://t.co/NSmtJ60yr3

Since taking the gavel on @SVACDems, my top priority has been addressing toxic exposure.

This bipartisan bill is a great start—but it's only our first step. We'll keep working to deliver for all generations of veterans suffering from toxic exposure.
https://t.co/M3fIUBG3cH

The rising cost of meat at the grocery store is a direct result of consolidation in the ag industry. Without competition, big packers are fixing prices and hurting both producers and consumers.

My Cattle Price Discovery and Transparency Act will help end this. Let's get it done.

This week, my colleagues and I introduced this bipartisan bill to cut red tape and protect Good Samaritans who are willing to step in and clean up.

This is good for our environment, for creating jobs, and for keeping our outdoor economy strong.
https://t.co/96CyShPqO7
Farmers need the right to repair what they own so they can do their jobs and feed this nation. It's that simple.

The Poverello Center does incredible work helping Montana vets find reliable housing across the state, and I’m proud to have led the effort in Congress to cut red tape on funding to help them further their mission in Missoula with this new space.
https://t.co/zFc1dQvuJE

We're delivering the economic growth we need to recover from this pandemic.

▶️ 467,000 jobs created just last month.
▶️ 6.6 MILLION jobs created in the first year.

The American Rescue Plan is getting folks safely back to work. Proud to stand with Montanans to get this done.

I'm closely following this ongoing elevator fire in Belgrade and want to extend my sympathies to those affected. As always, I'm grateful for the quick work of Montana's first responders who continue to assess the damage and fight to keep everybody safe. https://t.co/sVdeIwhNzQ

Started and ended my week taking questions from Montana students, because meeting with our state's next generation of leaders is truly the best part of my job.

A big thanks to Mr. Sigl at Red Lodge High School for letting me crash the classroom! https://t.co/SSAmEODnqu

Rooting hard for @TeamUSA as the Olympics kick off today! Cheering extra loud for the four Montanan athletes who are going for gold in freestyle skiing and ice hockey. #MontanaProud
https://t.co/wqqGOAURxB

Enjoyed discussing my new right to repair legislation with Montana's rural reporters.

Time is literally money on the farm, and the right to repair one's own equipment could make all the difference for producers just trying to do their jobs and make an honest living. https://t.co/7Wrfus3zTw

Corporate manufacturers have made it harder and harder for folks to work on their tractors themselves—forcing them to go to an authorized mechanic and pay an arm and a leg for necessary repairs.

It's unacceptable, and my right to repair bill will fix it.
https://t.co/as5THDeMVj

The big packers are screwing over producers and cheating consumers right before our eyes. This settlement is a small step in the right direction, but we've got to do more to hold them accountable.

Time to pass my Meat Packing Special Investigator Act.
https://t.co/hGdMLuNHJM

By upgrading our roads, bridges, airports, and seaports, we'll smooth the supply chain and grow our economy—without raising taxes on a single American family.

Transparency makes our democracy stronger.

These commonsense reforms will help ensure our democracy works for everyone—not just the wealthy and well connected. (8/8)

And last but not least, my Spotlight Act shines a light on dark money donors and gives the government the tools it needs to enforce our campaign finance laws, reversing a Trump-era rule that eliminated donor disclosure requirements for certain tax-exempt organizations. (7/8)

The Honest Ads Act would require disclaimers on digital ads and require large online platforms to keep a public database of who is purchasing political ads—ensuring digital ads have the same requirements as those on TV or radio and letting folks know who is paying for them. (6/8)

The DISCLOSE Act would keep foreign actors from participating in American elections and increase transparency for major donors, so Montanans know exactly who is paying for the constant ads that flood their TVs and mailboxes during election season. (5/8)

The Cleaning Up Washington's Act, another bill of mine, would close the revolving door between D.C. lobbyists and Capitol Hill by banning former members of Congress and the Executive Branch from lobbying for five years after leaving civil service. (4/8)

I've also got the SUN Act, which would bring political spending out of the shadows by requiring tax-exempt non-profit organizations that engage in political activity to publicly disclose information about their big money online donors. (3/8)

My Corporations Are Not People Act is a constitutional amendment that would overturn the Supreme Court's harmful Citizens United decision and declare once and for all that corporations are NOT people. (2/8)

Citizens United is one of the worst decisions SCOTUS ever made. It opened the dark money floodgates and gave special interests too much power over our elections.

We've got to #EndCitizensUnited and kick dark money out of our elections for good—and I've got the bills to do it 🧵

Today marks two years since COVID-19 was first detected in the U.S. These two years have been immensely challenging, and it's critical we work together to prevent this pandemic from claiming yet another year.

Get vaccinated. Get boosted. Get tested regularly.

Corporations are not people. Citizens United was a disastrous decision that's allowed dark money to corrode our politics to this day. It's time to pass my constitutional amendment to #EndCitizensUnited and finally bring transparency to our elections.
